briefdescription.para: The type of element held in MatType.
So other classes can use TreeType::Mat.
The index of the first point in the dataset contained in this node (and its children).
The minimum bounding rectangle of the points held in the node (and its children).
The children held by this node.
The number of points of the dataset contained in this node (and its children).
The dataset.
The distance to the furthest descendant, cached to speed things up.
An instantiated metric.
The parent (NULL if this node is the root).
The distance from the center of this node to the center of the parent.
The statistic.
Friend access is given for the default constructor.
Initialize the tree from a cereal archive.

parameterdescription.para: Archive to load tree from. Must be an iarchive, not an oarchive.

briefdescription.para: Construct this as the root node of an octree on the given dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This copies the dataset. If you don't want to copy the input dataset, consider using the constructor that takes an rvalue reference and use std::move().

parameterdescription.para: Dataset to create tree from. This will be copied!
Maximum number of points in a leaf node.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &data, std::vector< size_t > &oldFromNew, const size_t maxLeafSize=20)
memberdef.name: Octree

briefdescription.para: Construct this as the root node of an octree on the given dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This copies the dataset and modifies its ordering; a mapping of the old point indices to the new point indices is filled. If you don't want the matrix to be copied, consider using the constructor that takes an rvalue reference and use std::move().

parameterdescription.para: Dataset to create tree from. This will be copied!
Vector which will be filled with the old positions for each new point.
Maximum number of points in a leaf node.

memberdef.argsstring: (const MatType &data, std::vector< size_t > &oldFromNew, std::vector< size_t > &newFromOld, const size_t maxLeafSize=20)
memberdef.name: Octree

briefdescription.para: Construct this as the root node of an octree on the given dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This copies the dataset and modifies its ordering; a mapping of the old point indices to the new point indices is filled, and a mapping of the new point indices to the old point indices is filled. If you don't want the matrix to be copied, consider using the constructor that takes an rvalue reference and use std::move().

parameterdescription.para: Dataset to create tree from. This will be copied!
Vector which will be filled with the old positions for each new point.
Vector which will be filled with the new positions for each old point.
Maximum number of points in a leaf node.

briefdescription.para: Copy the given tree.

detaileddescription.para: Be careful! This may use a lot of memory.

parameterdescription.para: Tree to copy from.

briefdescription.para: Construct this as the root node of an octree on the given dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This will take ownership of the dataset; if you don't want this, consider using the constructor that takes a const reference to the dataset.

parameterdescription.para: Dataset to create tree from. This will be copied!
Maximum number of points in a leaf node.

briefdescription.para: Construct this as the root node of an octree on the given dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This will take ownership of the dataset; if you don't want this, consider using the constructor that takes a const reference to the dataset. This modifies the ordering of the dataset; a mapping of the old point indices to the new point indices is filled.

parameterdescription.para: Dataset to create tree from. This will be copied!
Vector which will be filled with the old positions for each new point.
Maximum number of points in a leaf node.

memberdef.argsstring: (MatType &&data, std::vector< size_t > &oldFromNew, std::vector< size_t > &newFromOld, const size_t maxLeafSize=20)
memberdef.name: Octree

briefdescription.para: Construct this as the root node of an octree on the given dataset.

detaileddescription.para: This will take ownership of the dataset; if you don't want this, consider using the constructor that takes a const reference to the dataset. This modifies the ordering of the dataset; a mapping of the old point indices to the new point indices is filled, and a mapping of the new point indices to the old point indices is filled.

parameterdescription.para: Dataset to create tree from. This will be copied!
Vector which will be filled with the old positions for each new point.
Vector which will be filled with the new positions for each old point.
Maximum number of points in a leaf node.

briefdescription.para: Move the given tree.

detaileddescription.para: The tree passed as a parameter will be emptied and will not be usable after this call.

parameterdescription.para: Tree to move.

memberdef.argsstring: (Octree *parent, const size_t begin, const size_t count, const arma::vec &center, const double width, const size_t maxLeafSize=20)
memberdef.name: Octree

briefdescription.para: Construct this node as a child of the given parent, starting at column begin and using count points.

detaileddescription.para: The ordering of that subset of points in the parent's data matrix will be modified! This is used for recursive tree-building by the other constructors that don't specify point indices.

parameterdescription.para: Parent of this node. Its dataset will be modified!
Index of point to start tree construction with.
Number of points to use to construct tree.
Center of the node (for splitting).
Width of the node in each dimension.
Maximum number of points in a leaf node.

memberdef.argsstring: (Octree *parent, const size_t begin, const size_t count, std::vector< size_t > &oldFromNew, const arma::vec &center, const double width, const size_t maxLeafSize=20)
memberdef.name: Octree

briefdescription.para: Construct this node as a child of the given parent, starting at column begin and using count points.

detaileddescription.para: The ordering of that subset of points in the parent's data matrix will be modified! This is used for recursive tree-building by the other constructors that don't specify point indices.

A mapping of the old point indices to the new point indices is filled, but it is expected that the vector is already allocated with size greater than or equal to (begin + count), and if that is not true, invalid memory reads (and writes) will occur.

parameterdescription.para: Parent of this node. Its dataset will be modified!
Index of point to start tree construction with.
Number of points to use to construct tree.
Vector which will be filled with the old positions for each new point.
Center of the node (for splitting).
Width of the node in each dimension.
Maximum number of points in a leaf node.

briefdescription.para: Destroy the tree.
Modify the bound object for this node.
Return the bound object for this node.
Store the center of the bounding region in the given vector.
Return the specified child.

detaileddescription.para: If the index is out of bounds, unspecified behavior will occur.

briefdescription.para: Return the specified child.

detaileddescription.para: If the index is out of bounds, unspecified behavior will occur.

briefdescription.para: Return the pointer to the given child.

detaileddescription.para: This allows the child itself to be modified.

briefdescription.para: Return the dataset used by this node.
Return the index (with reference to the dataset) of a particular descendant.
Return the furthest possible descendant distance.

detaileddescription.para: This returns the maximum distance from the centroid to the edge of the bound and not the empirical quantity which is the actual furthest descendant distance. So the actual furthest descendant distance may be less than what this method returns (but it will never be greater than this).

briefdescription.para: Return the furthest distance to a point held in this node.

detaileddescription.para: If this is not a leaf node, then the distance is 0 because the node holds no points.

briefdescription.para: Return the index of the furthest child node to the given query node.

detaileddescription.para: If it can't decide, it will return NumChildren() (invalid index).

memberdef.argsstring: (const VecType &point, typename std::enable_if_t< IsVector< VecType >::value > *=0) const
memberdef.name: GetFurthestChild

briefdescription.para: Return the index of the furthest child node to the given query point.

detaileddescription.para: If this is a leaf node, it will return NumChildren() (invalid index).

briefdescription.para: Return the index of the nearest child node to the given query node.

detaileddescription.para: If it can't decide, it will return NumChildren() (invalid index).

memberdef.argsstring: (const VecType &point, typename std::enable_if_t< IsVector< VecType >::value > *=0) const
memberdef.name: GetNearestChild

briefdescription.para: Return the index of the nearest child node to the given query point.

detaileddescription.para: If this is a leaf node, it will return NumChildren() (invalid index).

briefdescription.para: Return whether or not the node is a leaf.
Return the maximum distance to another node.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VecType &point, typename std::enable_if_t< IsVector< VecType >::value > *=0) const
memberdef.name: MaxDistance

briefdescription.para: Return the maximum distance to the given point.
Return the metric that this tree uses.
Return the minimum distance to another node.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VecType &point, typename std::enable_if_t< IsVector< VecType >::value > *=0) const
memberdef.name: MinDistance

briefdescription.para: Return the minimum distance to the given point.
Return the minimum distance from the center of the node to any bound edge.
Return the number of children in this node.
Return the number of descendants of this node.
Return the number of points in this node (0 if not a leaf).
Copy the given Octree.

parameterdescription.para: The tree to be copied.

briefdescription.para: Take ownership of the given Octree.

parameterdescription.para: The tree to take ownership of.

briefdescription.para: Modify the pointer to the parent (be careful!).
Get the pointer to the parent.
Modify the distance from the center of this node to the center of the parent node.
Return the distance from the center of this node to the center of the parent node.
Return the index (with reference to the dataset) of a particular point in this node.

detaileddescription.para: If the given index is invalid (i.e. if it is greater than NumPoints()), the indices returned will be invalid.

briefdescription.para: Return the minimum and maximum distance to another node.

memberdef.argsstring: (const VecType &point, typename std::enable_if_t< IsVector< VecType >::value > *=0) const
memberdef.name: RangeDistance

briefdescription.para: Return the minimum and maximum distance to another node.
Serialize the tree.
Modify the statistic object for this node.
Return the statistic object for this node.
A default constructor.

detaileddescription.para: This is meant to only be used with cereal, which is allowed with the friend declaration below. This does not return a valid treee! The method must be protected, so that the serialization shim can work with the default constructor.

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::vec &center, const double width, const size_t maxLeafSize)
memberdef.name: SplitNode

briefdescription.para: Split the node, using the given center and the given maximum width of this node.

parameterdescription.para: Center of the node.
Width of the current node.
Maximum number of points allowed in a leaf.

memberdef.argsstring: (const arma::vec &center, const double width, std::vector< size_t > &oldFromNew, const size_t maxLeafSize)
memberdef.name: SplitNode

briefdescription.para: Split the node, using the given center and the given maximum width of this node, and fill the mappings vector.

parameterdescription.para: Center of the node.
Width of the current node.
Mappings from old to new.
Maximum number of points allowed in a leaf.
